intro: Stauranthera umbrosa var. umbrosa, commonly known as the dark stauranthera, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded garden settings. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for humid, low-light conditions.
